Arm yourself: If you have the means and the legal right to own a firearm, it could be a useful tool for protecting yourself in case of a law enforcement absence. However, it is important to know how to use it safely and responsibly.
Join a community or group: Forming connections with like-minded individuals who share your values and beliefs can provide an additional layer of protection and support.
Be aware of your surroundings: Staying vigilant and being able to read situations and people can help you avoid dangerous situations before they escalate.
Keep emergency supplies on hand: Having a stockpile of essential items such as food, water, and first aid supplies can help you survive in case of an emergency.
Learn about local laws and regulations: Understanding the legal framework of your area can help you navigate potential risks and stay within the law.
